medical: Informed consent was obtained after explanation of the procedure, as well as risk factors of bleeding, perforation, adverse medication reaction. The patient was placed in the left lateral decubitus position, medicated with the above medications to achieve and maintain a conscious sedation. Vital signs were monitored throughout the procedure without evidence of hemodynamic compromise or desaturation. The Olympus single-channel endoscope was passed under direct visualization through the oral cavity and advanced to the second portion of the duodenum. FINDINGS: ESOPHAGUS: Proximal and mid esophagus were without abnormalities. STOMACH: Insufflated and retroflexed visualization of the gastric cavity revealed DUODENUM: Normal.
layman: The patient gave informed consent after we explained the procedure and the risks of bleeding, perforation, and medication reactions. The patient was turned on their left side and given medication to keep them calm but awake. We monitored their vital signs the entire time and saw no problems with blood pressure or breathing. An Olympus singleâ€‘channel endoscope was guided through the mouth and advanced to the second part of the duodenum. FINDINGS: ESOPHAGUS: The upper and middle parts of the esophagus looked normal. STOMACH: When we inflated the stomach and looked back, everything looked normal. DUODENUM: Normal.
